subject: Real Estate
title: The End of Homeownership As We Know It
description: One-minute skill: The End of Homeownership As We Know It.

hook.text: In 2000, owning a home was the default goal. By 2050, it might be as outdated as owning a horse.

buildup.text: Subscription living, co-ownership, tokenization, and corporate landlords are all eroding traditional ownership.

discovery.text: Gen Z views homeownership with skepticism. Flexibility, mobility, and experiences rank higher than property.

twist.text: But wealth inequality data is clear: homeowners build 40x more wealth than renters over a lifetime.

climax.text: The future of real estate isn't one model. It's a spectrum â€” from owning to subscribing to sharing.

punchline.text: Owning a home may become a choice, not the default dream.

quiz.question: How much more wealth do homeowners build compared to renters?
